I0408-d-04-30-08-PATH.Narrative: At approximately 11:59am, an electrical fire ignited inside cable manhole 67 located inside Tunnel A- Christopher St station, approximately 4 - 5 feet behind the platformed 11:52am - 33rd to Hobokentrain (668-172-731-849-657-748-732).  The train pulled into the station and lost power.  The Conductor reported hearing a loud pop and saw smoke toward the back of the train.  The Conductor notifies the Trainmaster and instructs her to move the passengers into the adjacent car and to cutout the panel board switches.  The Conductor completes the task and informs the Trainmaster that smoke was accumulating.  The Trainmaster notifies the police desk and activates, removes power and activates the fans to remove smoke.  The doors of the train remained closed throughout the smoke condition as the Conductor communicated with a PA officer through the window.  An Operations Examiner was on the traid evacuated 25 passengers in 1 minute.  By 12:04pm, all PATH crews were out of the station as FDNYarrives and conducts a search for of the origin of the fire. As a result, 332 trains were evacuatedand train service was suspended between 33rd Street and Hoboken and Journal Square and 33rd St from11:59am on April 30 until 6:00am May 1, until the problem was corrected.   The only injuries reported at this time are for two responding Port Authority police officers due to  exposure to smoke.Finding: 	The electrical fire initiated in an open cable chamber in manhole 67 due to overheated c

THE CONDUCTOR BEGAN WALKING BACK ANDDISCOVERED 5 CARS HAD DERAILED - 3 ON THEIR SIDES & 2 DERAILED BUT UPRIGHT. CAUSE DUE TO THIRD PARTYBROKEN RAIL - 8520# JOINTED RAIL.

205978-d-04-01-08-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 290-31 WAS ADVISED TO TIE ONTO CARS ON CDUNB TRACK. THESE CARS HAD BEEN WORKED BY THE CARMAN &WERE ADVISED NOT TO CUT IN THE AIR. CREW TIED ON, TOOK OFF HANDBRAKES, DID A STRETCH & STARTED SHOVING BACK. LIGHT INDICATION ON POLE SHOWED 3 LIGHTS LEFT & CONDUCTOR ADVISED ENGINEER, WHO TOOK A BRAKE PIPE REDUCTION.  SHORTLY THEREAFTER TRAIN 290-31 WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND HUMP YARDMASTER ADVISED290 RAN INTO THE SIDE OF CARS ON HUMP LEAD.  INVESTIGATION DETERMINED THE KNUCKLE BETWEEN CAR SOO 63027 & PLMX 50081 HAD COME APART DUE TO A FLAW IN THE KNUCKLE ON THE SOO 63027 WHICH FAILED AFTER ANUNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION DUE TO  BRAKE VALVE MALFUNCTION.  THIS CAUSED THE REAR 48 CARSOF THE SHOVE (WITH NO AIR OR BRAKES) TO RUN OUT FOUL ON WEST END, INTO THE SIDE OF CARS ON HUMP LEAD.  RE-INACTMENT OF THE INCIDENT COULD NOT DUPLICATE THE UNDESIRED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION CAUSED BY BRAKE VALVE MALFUNCTION AND UNABLE TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC CAR THAT CAUSED THIS TO OCCUR.

THE CREW STOPPED TO CUT THEREAR OF THE TRAIN AND WHEN THEY STARTED PULLING AGAIN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND THE CREW FOUND 5 CARS DERAILED. 593079-d-04-18-08-IC.Primary Accident Cause: Car(s) shoved out and left out of clear
593079-d-04-18-08-IC.Accident Cause: Car(s) shoved out and left out of clear
593079-d-04-18-08-IC.Narrative: IC CREW HAD SET CAR, SBLX 15023, INTO TRACK FOR PICK-UP BY KCS TRAIN WITH 5 OTHER CARS.  THE KCS TRAIN, LGP 101, WAS SWITCHING AND BUILDING THEIR OUTBOUIND TRAIN IN THE BELL YARD ON VARIOUS TRACKS.  AFTER COMPLETING THEIR TRAIN, THE KCS CREW NOTIFIED THE IC THAT THEY LEFT CAR, SBLX 15023, BEHIND ACCOUNT SIDESWIPE DAMAGE AS THEY DEPARTED THE YARD.  AN INVESTIGATION WAS PERFORMED BY THE IC AND IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAR WAS SIDESWIPED ON THE SWITCHING LEAD BETWEEN TRACK 4 AND TRACK 7.  THE AEITAG FROM CAR SBLX 15023 WAS FOUND ON THE GROUND IN THE VICINITY WHERE THE KCS CREW HAD BEEN PERFORMED SWITCHING.  THE IC TRAINMASTER FOUND THAT IT WAS PHYSICAL IMPOSSIBLE FOR THE IC CREW TO HAVE CAUSED THE DAMAGE TO THE SIDE OF THE CAR THAT WAS IMPACTED.  THE KCS IS DENYING RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE DAMAGE.  THERE WAS NO TRACK DAMAGE.  THE DAMAGE TO SBLX 15023 WAS REPORTED TO BE $38,000.  KCS WILL NOT BE FILING  54 REPORT FOR THIS ACCIDENT - PER FAX COPY FROM KCS, RAILROAD IS DENYING ANY INVOLVEMENT IN THIS ACCIDENT.

2008092-d-04-08-08-ICE.Narrative: RAIL FAILED AT CROSSOVER SWITCH WHILE MOVEMENT WAS BEING MADE FROM EKC TO KNOCHE YARD.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.  THE CREW WAS NOT DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTED.  THIS DERAILMENT OCCURRED ON KCS TRACK.

2008103-d-04-25-08-ICE.Narrative: CREW WAS TRAVELING SOUTH AT 26 MPH.  CREW SAID IT FELT LIKE THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS ON THE GROUND AND PUTTHE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY.  20 CARS WERE DERAILED AS BRIDGE WASHED OUT.  THERE WERE NO  HAZARDOUS CARS IN THE CONSIST.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.  THE CREW WAS NOT DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTED DUE TO THE FACT THAT THIS DERAILMENT WAS WHOLLY ATTRIBUTABLE TO NATURAL CAUSE.  THIS TRACK WAS 132 JOINTED RAIL ONTHE BRIDGE AND 136 CWR OFF THE BRIDGE.  THERE HAD BEEN HEAVY RAIN THE NIGHT BEFORE AND INTO EARLY MORNING HOURS OF 4 TO 5 INCHES IN THIS AREA.  IT WAS NOT RAINING AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT.  TRACK HAD BEEN INSPECTED AFTER THE INITIAL HEAVY STORMS AND THERE WAS AN ISOLATED STORM CELL THAT LATERWENT THROUGH THIS AREA.  INCLUDED IN TRACK COSTS ARE $1,000,000 FOR A TEMPORARY BRIDGE AND $2,000,000 FOR A NEW BRIDGE.

D511008-d-04-28-08-PCC.Narrative: AT APROX 2130 ON APRIL 28 2008 THE ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR DERAILED 3 EMPTY TRI-LEVEL RAILCARS WHILEPULLING OUT OF THE MIRALOMA AUTO FACILITY. WHILE PULLING OUT THE LAST TRACK OF THE 3 TRACK OUTBOUNDTRAIN THEY WERE TOLD TO STOP AND THROW OUT A BAD ORDER CAR. THE ENGINEER, WHILE TRAVELING AT 8 MPH EFFECTED A FULL SERVICE RELEASE AND STOPPED THE TRAIN WITHIN A LITTLE OVER A CAR LENGTH DERAILING THEFIRST CAR. THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND THE CONDUCTOR INSTEAD OF INSPECTING THE TRAIN INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO BACK-UP CAUSING 2 MORE CARS TO DERAIL. AFTER THE ENGINEER STATED THAT HE COULD NOT MOVE THE TRAIN ANY FURTHER THE CONDUSTOR DECIDED TO WALK THE TRAIN AND DISCOVERED THE 3 DERAILED CARS ABOUT 20 CARS FROM THE REAR END.
